summary: This bill, the "National Law Enforcement Officers Remembrance, Support and Community Outreach Act," authorizes federal funding for the National Law Enforcement Museum in Washington, D.C. It directs the Secretary of the Interior to grant $6 million annually for seven years to the National Law Enforcement Officers Memorial Fund. These funds are designated for the museum's operational expenses, specifically to enhance community outreach, public education, and officer safety and wellness programs. The bill highlights the need to improve public understanding of law enforcement and address high rates of officer resignation and retirement by fostering a better relationship between police and the public.
